original_title: Delimitation Comm. submits report to Prime Minister
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A report prepared by the National Delimitation Committee was handed over to Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena
The Prime Minister's Media Unit said that the Chairman of the committee Mahinda Deshapriya handed over the report at the Prime Minister's office on Tuesday (11) morning.
The National Delimitation committee was formed by Prime Minister Dinesh Gunawardena last year via a gazette notification.
The former chairman of the Election Commission Mahinda Deshapriya was appointed to head the 4 member committee.
The primary objective of this committee was to ensure that the number of local government members are reduced from, 8000 to around 4000.
Anti-Terrorism Act, that is to replace the PTA, is an even more serious threat to democracy
